SEARCH
Package pt.ipp.isep.dei.esoft.project.application.controller.authorization

Class AuthenticationController

java.lang.Object
pt.ipp.isep.dei.esoft.project.application.controller.authorization.AuthenticationController
public class AuthenticationController extends Object
The AuthenticationController class manages authentication operations in the application. It provides methods for user login, logout, and retrieval of user roles.

The class defines constants for different user roles such as ROLE_ADMIN, ROLE_EMPLOYEE, ROLE_HRM, and ROLE_VFM. It delegates authentication operations to the AuthenticationRepository.

Example usage: 


 AuthenticationController authController = new AuthenticationController();
 boolean loggedIn = authController.doLogin("user@example.com", "password123");
 if (loggedIn) {
     List<UserRoleDTO> userRoles = authController.getUserRoles();
     // Process user roles
 } else {
     System.out.println("Login failed. Invalid credentials.");
 }

  • Method Details

    • doLogin

      public boolean doLogin(String email, String pwd)
      Attempts to authenticate a user with the provided email and password.
      Parameters:
      email - the user's email address
      pwd - the user's password
      Returns:
      true if the login is successful, false otherwise

    • getUIPath

      public String getUIPath(String userType)

    • getUserRoles

      public List<pt.isep.lei.esoft.auth.mappers.dto.UserRoleDTO> getUserRoles()
      Retrieves the roles associated with the currently logged-in user.
      Returns:
      a list of UserRoleDTO objects representing the user roles, or null if no user is logged in
